data.text: @AnnieTangent @teachbk @NYCSchools They're all off for high risk indoor high school sports too

@AnnieTangent @NYCSchools As a special Ed teacher you should know how masks and social distancing affect children. One way masking works great to protect you, although unfortunately the kids will still miss out a lot. https://t.co/EzYvftDouu
@AnnieTangent @NYCSchools Please have compassion for children in your class who will choose to unmask.

@TeacherNYC9 @AnnieTangent @NYCSchools We are giving everyone FREE COPIES of The Truth About Bullying book 📕 

FREE digital copies available from our website here; https://t.co/H87VCvLmk0

Paperback copies are also available from Amazon 📕

Please share to help more parents & teachers 🙏 https://t.co/dqO4JYWJQ4
@AnnieTangent @NYCSchools I sincerely hope students, parents and teachers go on strike in response to these changes
@AnnieTangent @NYCSchools Just as the U.S. is soon to hit the million-mark COVID death milestone. Good god.

@AnnieTangent @NYCSchools Now that we have at-home tests, many will not go out to get a PCR test. At-home tests are not reliable in detecting positive cases unless there is enough of a viral load, meaning that someone could be asymptomatic or mildly sypmtomatic and contagious days before testing positive.
